info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 17 at 8:57PM CDT until April 17 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR BUTLER...EASTERN MONROE...SOUTHEASTERN WILCOX AND CENTRAL CONECUH COUNTIES... At 856 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles south of Pine Apple, or 19 miles west of Greenville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Monroeville, Peterman, Georgiana, Excel, Beatrice, Repton and Pine Apple. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing destructive damaging hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
